revision.text:
{{Infobox Military Conflict |conflict=2008 Achamkhara incident |partof=[[Georgian-Abkhazian conflict]] |image= |caption= |date=July 9, 2008 |place=Mount Achamkhara, [[Gulripsh district]], [[Abkhazia]] |casus= |territory= |result=Aggravation of tensions |combatant1=[[Image:Flag of Abkhazia.svg|22px]] [[Military of Abkhazia|Abkhazian military]] |combatant2=[[Image:Flag of Georgia.svg|22px]] [[Military of Georgia|Georgian military]] |commander1= |commander2= |strength1= |strength2=~10 soldiers
(Abkhazian claims) |casualties1=2 wounded
(Abkhazian claims)
4 dead
(Georgian claims) |casualties2=3 wounded
(Georgian claims) |notes= }} The '''2008 Achamkhara incident''' refers to the armed confrontation, that took place on July 9, 2008, on the flanks of [[Mount Achamkhara]] in the internationally unrecognised [[Republic of Abkhazia]], between Abkhazian and Georgian troops. ==Background== At the time of the incident, Mount Achamkhara was located near the [[de facto]] border between the self-declared Republic of Abkhazia and the formerly Georgian-controlled [[Kodori Gorge]]. ==The incident== The claims of both sides are different, with conflicting versions of the events and there isn't any independent confirmation, on what took place.{{cite web |url=http://daccessdds.un.org/doc/UNDOC/GEN/N08/427/22/PDF/N0842722.pdf |title=Report of the Secretary-General on the situation in Abkhazia, Georgia |publisher=Security Council |date=2008-07-23 |accessdate = 2008-08-22 }} ===The Abkhazian view=== Abkhazia claims, that at 9:25 a.m., its security post on Mount Achamkhara was raided by around 10 Georgian attackers, using automatic weapons and grenade launchers. Two of its reservists were injured and had to be hospitalised.{{cite web |url=http://www.abkhaziagov.org/ru/president/press/news/detail.php?ID=11026 |title=Минобороны Абхазии обратилось к командованию миротворческих сил и Миссии ООН с просьбой расследовать инцидент в Кодорском ущелье |publisher=Администрация Президента Республики Абхазия |date=2008-07-10 |accessdate = 2008-08-22 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.civil.ge/eng/article.php?id=18737 |title=Skirmish in Kodori |publisher=Civil Georgia |date=2008-07-09 |accessdate = 2008-08-22 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20080817023905/http://www.civil.ge/eng/article.php?id=18737| archivedate= 17 August 2008 | deadurl= no}} ===The Georgian view=== Georgia claims, that its policemen were attacked by Abkhazian troops, while they were securing the Achamkhara heights in anticipation of a [[UNOMIG]] visit to the Kvabchara Valley. It further claims, that 3 of its police officers were injured and they in turn had killed 4 Abkhazian assailants. ==UNOMIG investigation== Both sides appealed to the [[UNOMIG]], with the wish to investigate the incident, which was started on June 10. It hasn't revealed anything yet. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Georgian-Abkhazian conflict}} {{Coord|43.135721|N|41.072109|E|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:2008 Achamkhara Incident}} [[Category:2008 in Georgia (country)|Achamkhara Incident, 2008]] [[Category:Georgian–Abkhazian conflict]] [[Category:2008 in Abkhazia|Achamkhara Incident, 2008]]
